results.description:
Welcome to our Meetup page for Shepherd Sports MTB Club!
We have rides scheduled every weekend unless otherwise noted. Visit our Shepherd Sports website here: Shepherd Sports Mountain Biking Home

All riders on Shepherd Cycling rides are asked to complete a waiver for the church. If you haven't yet completed a waiver, you can find the form under the "More/Files" section of our meetup.com page... or click this link: 2015_MountainBiking_­reg-wav. Bring your signed waiver form with you to the ride or one will be provided for you to sign before the ride.

Directions:

3701 Lost Hills Rd, Calabasas, CA  91301 (Map)

We will be meeting in front of the recreation center.

Take the 101 Freeway to the Lost Hills Road exit in Calabasas. At the end of the off-ramp proceed south toward the ocean. Park in the lot for Juan Bautist de Anza Park located on the northwest corner of Lost Hills and Las Virgenes Roads. Park along the street if the lot is full.

Ride Description:

Level: Beginner to Intermediate

Ride Duration: About 2 hours moving time / Total ride time approximately 3.5 hours with breaks

Miles/Roundtrip: 11.2 miles

Bathrooms at Trail: Yes - There are facilities at the beginning of the ride located on the right side of the recreation center building.  Also there are porta-potty restrooms located  within the park along the trail in a couple of places.

This ride starts from the Juan Batista de Anza park and continues into a single track over the Grasslands trail. We then cross over Mulholland road (watch out for cars/traffic) and continue into Malibu Creek State Park along the single track and onto a larger fire road. We have a few steep down hill spots and then a nice climb and down again to a rocky section that will require most to walk through. Then we are at the M*A*S*H TV Show Site. For the more adventurous we will continue further to the “Bull Dog” and do a half way up loop back to the M*A*S*H site, but this is some serious climbing for Intermediate tech and strong cardio riders. Finally we will backtrack and return to Juan Batista de Anza park.

This Strava link shows the route pretty well. Click the link to show you the area, the mileage, and the elevation gain.  It's about 2 hours for folks going to the Foundation. Note: if you have a Strava account you can login to see more detailed information.

https://www.strava.com/activities/305804128

View a GoogleEarth Flyover:

YouTubeLink: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AgdwRbuPdZs

IMPORTANT: Although some posted rides are considered intermediate to advanced level a strong beginner-level rider should be able to make it. As always, all riders should be aware that mountain biking can be extremely physically demanding. Each rider should be conscious of their own limitations. It is encouraged to walk any sections of the trail you are not comfortable riding. Don’t be surprised if you are not able to keep up with the group your first time out. Don’t get discouraged. It will take some newcomers a few rides before they can build up their leg strength, cardio and overall technique before feeling at home on a mountain bike trail. be encouraged– We will have volunteers that will help you along the way and stay with you at your pace. 

– See more Newcomer Recommendations at the bottom of this post.

What to Bring: 

• Helmet (mandatory) 

• Water (in bike cage and/or in your back pack)

• Snacks for energy 

• Extra bike tube and patch kit 

• Bike Pump

• Apparel appropriate for trail riding

• Protective eye ware 

• Sun screen lotion

• Multi-tools, etc. for mechanical issues

• 2-way radio if you have one (will select channel before ride)

– Please post comments or contact the ride hosts if you have any other questions or concerns about this ride. 

Newcomer Recommendations (cont.):

• Continue training throughout the week in order to build up strength and riding skills.

• Attend the CORBA (The Concerned Off-Road Bicyclists Association) Free Mountain Bike Skills Clinics, held the 1st Saturday of each month; 

http://www.corbamtb.com/programs/skills.shtml

"Although the Shepherd Church MTB Club in not affiliated with CORBA some or our riders have benefited immensely from the free training they provide. You can visit the CORBA website here: http://corbamtb.com/ and join their MeetUp Group Here: http://www.meetup.com/CORBAmtb/

"Happy Trails…"
results.name: Grasslands to Mash Site (from De Anza Park into Malibu Creek State Park)

results.description:
Come on out for the DanceFitWalk fitness party! Join us on Saturday at Balboa Park in Van Nuys, CA.  

We will meet in the parking lot just south of the River off of Balboa blvd. (between Victory and Burbank) 


We'll be DanceFitWalking around the park grounds.

Come and give it a try, it will be lots of fun!

Strongly Suggested Items to Bring: 

• Gloves (For working on the ground)

• Bottle of water or electrolyte drink 

• Fanny pack (to hold your bottle, keys, etc.)

• Athletic shoes

• Heart rate monitor

• Hat and/or sunblock


Also, don't forget to eat something an hour to 30 mins prior to working out.

Please arrive 10 minutes early. We will have liability waiver forms for first timers. You may print and fill out the forms ahead of time. Find them in the More section under Files.


Mark your calendars for 8:00am Saturday morning!

Can't wait to see YOU! ;-)

Questions? Call [masked]-DFW1
results.how_to_find_us: On the west-side of the Park, near the soccer fields. We will meet in the parking lot just south of the River off of Balboa blvd. (between Victory and Burbank)
results.name: DanceFitWalk - Fitness Party!

results.description:
Join Sam Thomson and me for an urban walk along the canals of Venice (California). Sam will be exploring this transformed community where he spent his formative years a long, long time ago.

We will meet at the Ballona Lagoon bright and early to beat the Labor Day weekend beach crowd. The total walk distance will be between 3 and 4 miles with an optional meeting after the walk at a local restaurant.

If you are in town on this holiday weekend, please try to join us on what will be a very different, but enjoyable, hike in a most unique area.

Dennis
results.how_to_find_us: Park on Via Dolce adjacent to the lagoon and look for Sam or me near the beginning of the Esplanade walkway.  I'll be wearing a "thrive" t-shirt.
results.name: Walk along the canals of Venice

group.name: THRIVE Los Angeles: Hiking, Biking, and Fitness

results.description:
A Weekend Morning Run

This is a 3.5 mile route in Griffith Park. 

Once we cross the river and the 5 freeway we'll head into the park and run along the dirt trails and the road making our way the LA Zoo and then turn around and head back the way we came. 

We'll end at the Los Feliz Cafe - anyone who has time, can stay for coffee or breakfast.

 

You can check out the route here.

We'll meet @ 8:00 am in the parking lot of the Los Feliz Cafe.   As usual, we'll wait about 10-15 minutes for stragglers and the head off. 


</a>


<a href="http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/49976520">
results.how_to_find_us: We'll wait in the parking lot or on the sidewalk in front of the cafe
results.name: Griffith Park Loop

results.description:
You’re invited to join our Saturday morning, beginners group ride starting from and ending at our Woodland Hills, Performance Bicycle store. The ride is for beginners and those getting back on the saddle. The average pace will be between 9-14 miles per hour and the ride will last approximately 1.5 hrs. We’ll explore some of the local bike paths available to you and experience some residential riding as well. The ride is a “No Rider Left Behind” ride. Come out and join our ride leaders, for some fun outdoors.

Bring a helmet, water bottle and a spare tube.

You can also find us at: https://www.facebook.com/PerformanceBicycleWoodlandHills
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in the store at 7:45am. Roll at 8am.
results.name: Saturday Beginner Group Ride- No Drop!

group.name: Performance Bicycle Great Ride Series: Woodland Hills

results.description:
These are two great mini-tennis courts that nobody is using.  They have wonderful dimensions, perfect for our game, with working nets that I think we can use crutches on.  They also have lights, so we can possibly schedule some future evening meetups. Plenty of parking right alongside the courts.

For the present, Doug and I feel that, even though they might be father away for some of us, they present a much more friendly atmosphere than Glen Alla Park.  So, let's give it a try for next Saturday, August 8.
results.how_to_find_us: There are two courts here at the end of Roberts Ave, south of Washington Blvd, in Culver City
results.name: Saturday Pickleball
BRING A FRIEND VIP BREAKFAST RIDES 8am & 9am

results.description:
Two ways to help (your choice):

(1)  Help in their kitchen with food prep, assembling burritos, and/or clean-up.

(2)  Drive and drop off burritos to an assigned shelter/agency in downtown LA, Hermosa Beach, Long Beach, Santa Monica, Venice, or Wilmington.

_________________________________________________

They start at 7:00am, but arriving around 8:00am or 9:00am is fine.  Volunteers help in the kitchen with the food (burritos) and finish around 11:00am. 

The second shift (10:00am) is intended more for delivering (driving) to the various shelters to drop off the food.

The location has limited parking on the side of the building.  Street/residential parking is near Garnet St...usually free, but please check posted signs.  The entrance to the kitchen is in the back of the building, so look for an open door in the back (alley).

One volunteer said each week varies...sometimes they have many volunteers, and sometimes not enough.  Since the kitchen can sometimes get crowded, they suggest arriving early to secure a spot and task.

Photos:

www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a[masked]

www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a[masked]

_________________________________________________

Mother's Kitchen from the MA Center LA (aka Amma Los Angeles) is a separate group that helps make and distribute burritos every Saturday.

Even though this is automatically posted, please check their website to confirm it's really scheduled & occurring on this date: http://amma.org/groups/north-america/ma-center-la/events/mothers-kitchen-burrito-project


http://amma.org/news/burrito-project-macenter

http://tbrnews.com/news/redondo_beach/project-s-goal-burritos-for-the-needy/article_61c59706-33cc-11e4-ae36-0019bb2963f4.html

www.facebook.com/groups/[masked]

Young children may not be allowed in the kitchen, but they can "help decorate the paper bags that meals are delivered in to the 12 participating shelters."


"Burrito meals are delivered each week to Teen Runaway Emergency Shelter, in Hermosa Beach; New Directions Oasis for Women and Upward Bound Family Shelter, both in Mar Vista; Samoshel emergency shelter, Santa Monica Police Activities League, (PAL), Day Break, Safe Haven and Turning Point, all in Santa Monica; Harbor City Community Job Center, Wilmington; Reach for the Top, Venice Beach; the Downtown Women’s Center, in downtown L.A. and Long Beach Union Rescue Mission’s Samaritan House."

If interested in helping, please remember to check their schedule http://amma.org/groups/north-america/ma-center-la/events/mothers-kitchen-burrito-project

First-timers can also call[masked] and press 3 to hear a description about Project Burrito.

Any questions can be directed at Gayle via [masked] or Arati via [masked]

http://amma.org/groups/north-america/ma-center-la/projects/mothers-kitchen
results.how_to_find_us: This is a "no host" event. If other members sign up, maybe post a comment below, or contact each other in advance, and coordinate together on how best to meet one another. Thanks for helping. Have fun!
results.name: Food for Homeless, Teens, Veterans & Women (Redondo Beach)

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
